page.title: 12North Watford cemetery
page.content: The North Watford Cemetery was first opened in 1931. It has an area of 35 acres. There are many graves there, some just marked with little wooden crosses while others have gravestones. One of the stones is worth 1000 pounds and 2 others have photographs of the people who are buried there on them. My mum is buried in this cemetery. Also there is a mass grave for 12 of the 40 people who were killed when a V1 rocket bomb fell on Sandringham Road near Parkgate School on July 30th 1944. North Watford Cemetery is a well-kept, peaceful place which is interesting to visit.
